author: matt_kowalski
post: Ordinary photographs may have some 3d information, but it is distorted by the directionality of the light source. The relatively undistorted 3d information found on the shroud can be duplicated by photographing a white statue immersed in colored water, but the fact remains that the shroud image is different from most photographs. One might describe it it as resembling a perfectly “light balanced” photo. Or perhaps similar to an expertly drawn NEGATIVE charcoal sketch in which the artist masterfully faded the boundaries of the figure. I understand why Colin Berry wants to pursue contact theories, but everything he has suggested so far was tried and abandoned long ago by other researchers..
title: It is really, really time to rethink what we think about 3D
